title: Spectrality of Moran-type measures with staggered contraction ratios
authors: Jun Jason Luo and Lin Mao
abstract:
Let $ \{\phi_{k,d}\}_{d\in D_{2p_k}, k\geq 1} $ be a Moran-type iterated
function system (IFS) defined by $ \phi_{k,d}(x)=(-1)^d b_k^{-1}(x+d) $, where
$ \{b_k\}_{k=1}^{\infty}, \{p_k\}_{k=1}^{\infty} $ are the sequences of integer
numbers with $ b_k\geq 2p_k\geq 2 $ and $ D_{2p_k}=\{0,1,\dots,2p_k-1\}, k\ge
1$. We first show that the Moran-type IFS induces uniquely a Borel probability
measure $ \mu $, then show that the $ \mu $ is a spectral measure provided $
2p_{k}\mid b_{k} $ for all $ k\geq 2 $. Our result extends the recent works by
An and He \cite{An-He2014} and Wu \cite{Wu2024}.
